metadata.Title: CVE-2023-1990 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low.
metadata.Description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in ndlc_remove in drivers/nfc/st-nci/ndlc.c in the Linux Kernel. This flaw could allow an attacker to crash the system due to a race problem. It was discovered that the ST NCI NFC driver did not properly handle device removal events. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1990` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic-lpae - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic-64k - 6.3.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-lowlatency - 6.3.0-6.6.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-lowlatency-64k - 6.3.0-6.6.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-6.3.0-7-generic-lpae - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic - 6.3.0-7.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.3.0-7-generic-64k - 6.3.0-7.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-lowlatency - 6.3.0-6.6.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-lowlatency-64k - 6.3.0-6.6.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: cascardo> requires removal of the device
